text.section: When an applicant for a license files the application and pays the fees required by § 11-604 of this subtitle, the Commissioner shall conduct an investigation to determine if the applicant meets the requirements of § 11-605 of this subtitle.
The Commissioner shall issue a license to an applicant who meets the requirements of § 11-605 of this subtitle.

If the Commissioner notifies an applicant that the application is incomplete:
The Commissioner's notice shall itemize the steps which the applicant must take to complete the application; and
The application shall not be approved until after the applicant supplies or completes all items and steps identified in the Commissioner's notice.

The Commissioner may deny an application:
If the applicant fails to qualify for a license under this subtitle; or
For any reason that a license may be revoked or suspended under this subtitle or a mortgage lender license may be suspended or revoked under § 11-517 of this title.
The Commissioner shall approve or deny an application within 60 days after the Commissioner receives a completed application.
